definition: anonymous state-sponsored Internet commentator/abbr. for 網絡特工|网络特工
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
shit youth/used satirically against 憤青|愤青 which shares the same sound/see also 憤青|愤青[fen4 qing1]
fifty cents party (person supposed to relay government propaganda on Internet sites)
(neologism) person who posts online in support of the Chinese government, but unlike a wumao 五毛[wu3 mao2], is not paid for doing so (abbr. for 自帶乾糧的五毛|自带干粮的五毛[zi4 dai4 gan1 liang2 de5 wu3 mao2])
angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
human flesh search engine/a large-scale collective effort to find details about a person or event (Internet slang)
pinyin: ren2 rou4 sou1 suo3 yin3 qing2

definition: "sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: to mislead the public with rumors/to delude the people with lies
"honker", Chinese hacker motivated by patriotism, using one's skills to protect domestic networks and work in national interest
to start rumours and create trouble
strange tales and absurd arguments (idiom)/unreasonable remarks
